publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; incipit of the text and of its sections; incipit of the articles; name of the donor; abbreviations referring to other works; words mǝʿǝraf “chapter”, kǝfl “section”, gäṣ “chapter”, śǝrwaṣ “insertion”; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. A few lines alternating with black lines on fols. 3r (incipit of the text) and 63rb.

msItem.note: Abbreviations referring to other works are explained in the Introduction.

msItem.colophon: Fol. 2va: ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ፍትሐ፡ ነገሥት። ዘአጽሐፈቶ፡ በንዋያ፡ ወይዘሮ፡ ወለተ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ለስሑል፡ ሚካኤል፡ ርእሰ፡ መኳንንት፡ በትፍጻሜተ፡ ሢመቱ፡ እምቅድመ፡ ሞቱ፡ በ፬፡ አውራኅ። በዳግማዊ፡ ዓመተ፡ ምንግሥቱ፡ ለንጉሥነ፡ ተክለ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ በዘመነ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወንጌላዊ። ወወሀበቶ፡ ለደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ መካነ፡ አቡነ፡ አረጋዊ። እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ሥዩመ፡ በዕብሬቱ፡ አቡነ፡ ክፍለ፡ ሥላሴ፡ በከዊነ፡ መምህር፡ ወኖላዊ። … The colophon states that wäyzäro Wälättä Giyorgis, wife of ras Mikaʾel “Sǝḥul” (ca. 1691-1777), commissioned the book in the 2nd year of reign of King Täklä Giyorgis (= 1780 A.D.), four months before the death of her husband, in the year of John the Evangelist (cp. ChChron 169), and donated it to Däbrä Dammo during the tenure of abbot ʾAbunä Kǝflä Śǝllase.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 138.0 folios, of which 2.0 blank fols. 1r, 128v., in 15.0 quires (A + 14).
32.0 28.0 6.1

signatures.note: Undecorated quire marks are written in modern red pen in the left upper margin: fols. 3r: ፩, 13r: ፪, 23r: ፫, 33r: ፬, 43r: ፭, 53r: ፮, 63r: ፯, 73r: ፰, 83r: ፱, 93r: ፲, 103r: ፲፩, 113r: ፲፪, 123r: ፲፫, 133r: ፲፬.

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. has been resewn with a modern synthetic thread. The spine cover is missing, probably cut off to facilitate resewing. Tears amended on fols. 78, 84, 85, 91, 92, 126.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item:
Fol. 1v: Purchase note. Fol. 1v: ዘምምር፡[sic] ገብረ፡ መድኀን፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ሲገዛ፡ መምህር፡ ሰብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ ወልደ፡ አቢየ፡ አጥቁ፡ ገብረ፡ ሚካኤል፡ መዝሙር፡ ነበሩ፡ የተገዛ፡ በ፲፡ ብር፡ ነው
The note is written in Amharic in a crude hand. The price of the book is indicated as 10 Bǝrr.

Fol. 2ra-rc: Inventory of land possessions of Däbrä Dammo. Fol. 2ra: ኆልቈ፡ ገራውሕ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ …
The note is written in the same hand as Additio 1.

Fol. 2vb, ls. 1-11: Inventory of items. Fol. 2vb, ls. 1-3: ኍልቈ፡ ንዋያት፡ ዘተኈለቈ፡ በሢመተ፡ መምህር፡ ቃለ፡ አብ፡ …
The note was drawn up during the tenure of abbot (mämhǝr) Qalä ʾAb. It aso mentions mämhǝr Wäldä Arägawi.

Fol. 2vb, ls. 12-32: Inventory of items. Fol. 2vb, ls. 12-14: ኍልቈ፡ ንዋያት፡ ዘተኈለቈ፡ በሢመተ፡ መምህር፡ ገብረ፡ አረጋዊ፡ …
The note is written in Gǝʿǝz and Amharic. It was drawn up during the tenure of abbot (mämhǝr) Gäbrä ʾArägawi and lists paraphernalia and the general number of books. It also mentions qes gäbäz Täsfa Śǝllase and qes Gäbrä Maryam.

Fol. 2vc: Land transaction note. Fol. 2vc: ያቶ: ገድሉ፡ ሪም፡ የነበራ፡ ቤተ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ተሣየጥኩ፡ አነ፡ ልጅ፡ አባይ፡ እምአቶ፡ ገድሉ፡ እንድርያስ፡ በ፬ብር፡ ለዋና። …
The note is written in Gǝʿǝz and Amharic. Its states that lǝǧ ʾAbbay purchased a rim-land from ʾato Gädlu ʾƎndrǝyas; it also mentions several individuals as witnesses, nǝburä ʾǝd Wäldä Giyorgis and King Yoḥannǝs IV.

Fol. 136va-vb: Inventory of items and books.
The note is written in a mediocre hand. It was drawn up during the tenure of abbot (mämhǝr) Täklä Giyorgis and lists paraphernalia and books with their quantity. It also mentions qesä gäbäz Wäldä ʾAlfa, qesä gäbäz Gäbrä ʾArägawi and ʾafä gäbäz Gäbrä Krǝstos.

Fol. 136vb, ls. 13-27: Land grant issued by ras Mängäša for Däbrä Maryam (?). Fol. 136vb, ls. 13-17: ይቤ፡ ራስ፡ መንገሻ፡ ወልደ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ነገሥት፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወሐብኩ፡ ምድረ፡ አግአ፡ ጥርቄ፡ ለደብረ፡ ማርያም፡ …
The note states that ras Mängäša (1868-1906), son of King Yoḥannǝs IV, donated a land property to Däbrä Maryam.

Fol. 136vc, ls. 1-25: Inventory of books and items. Fol. 136vc, ls. 1-5: ኌልቀ፡ [sic] መጻሕፍት፡ ፸፰ቱ፡ ኌልቀ፡ ስያዳ፡ ፶፪ት፡ ኌልቀ፡ ግብረ፡ መርፍዕ፡ ፶፮ት፡ …
The note was written in a mediocre hand during the reign of King Yoḥannǝs IV and the tenure of abbot (mämhǝr) Täklä Giyorgis. It also mentions ʾagbaz ʾabba Wäldä ʾAlfa and ʾabba Gäbrä ʾArägawi.

Fol. 136vc, ls. 26-34: Inventory of items and books. Fol. 136vc, ls. 26-29: ኍልቈ፡ ምንጻፍ፡ ዘስያዳ፡ ፶፬፡ ኍልቈ፡ ግምጅ፡ ፻፲፬፡ ሶራ፡ ፷፪፡ ኍልቈ፡ መጻሕፍት፡ ፹፪። …
The note was drawn up during the tenure of abbot (mämhǝr) Wäldä ʿAbiy ʾƎgziʾ and lists paraphernalia and the general number of books. It also mentions qes gäbäz Gäbrä ʾIyäsus and qes gäbäz Wäldä ʿAbiy ʾƎgziʾ. Some letters are partly erased.

Fols. 137ra-138ra: History of Däbrä Dammo. Fol. 137ra: ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ታሪክ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ መቅደሰ፡ አባ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ዘከመ፡ ተነሥተት፡ ወተሐንፀት። … Fol. 137ra: “We begin with the help of God the book of the Story of Däbrä Dammo, sanctuary of ʾabba ʾArägawi, how it was destroyed and built …” The note states that the sanctuary was destroyed by an earthquake during the first year of reign of King ʾIyasu III (= 1784 A.D.), 270 years after that king Lǝbnä Dǝngǝl had built it, and it was rebuilt thanks to däǧǧazmač Wäldä Gäbrǝʾel. The note also mentions other individuals: Zä-Giyorgis, Fǝśśǝḥa Ṣǝyon, ʾAnqäṣä Haymanot, etc. Nomina sacra (Maryam) and elements of Ethiopic numerals are rubricated.

Fol. 138ra-rb: Inventory of books and items. Fol. 138ra: ኍልቈ፡ መጻሕፍት፡ ፩ኦሪት፡ ሐምስቱ፡ ስንክሳር፡ …
The note is written in a crude hand. Series of dashes have been inserted above many items in the second part of the note.

Fol. 138rc, ls. 5-13: Inventory of items. Fol. 138rc, ls. 5-8: ኍልቍ፡ ንዋያት፡ ዘተጽሕፈ፡ በዘመነ፡ መምህር፡ ኪዳነ፡ ቃል፡ …
The note was drawn up during the tenure of abbot (mämhǝr) Kidanä Qal.

Fol. 138rc, ls. 14-25: Inventory of items. Fol. 138rc, ls. 14-18: ኍልቈ፡ ንዋያት፡ ዘቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘተኈለቈ፡ በዘመነ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ በአባ፡ ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ መምሕርነት፡ …
The note was drawn up during the reign of King Yoḥannǝs IV and the tenure of abbot (mämhǝr) Sǝbḥat lä-ʾAb. It also mentions ʾabba Näṣṣärä ʾAb and ʾabba Wäldä Ḥǝy(wä)t.

- The title ፍትሐ፡ ነገሥት፡ is written on the upper right margin of fol. 1r in modern blue pen. - Gǝʿǝz and Amharic comments are written in a secondary hand in a small script in the margins or in the intercolumns: e.g., fols. 10v, 28r, 29r, 34r, 36v, 73r, 76r. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of two perpendicular lines (˧ or ┴), indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margin, belong: fols. 11va, 13va, 15va, 20ra, 26va, 31va, 40rc, 53vc, 77ra. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 4rb, 18ra, 36rc, 45rc, 70rc, 98rb. - Omitted letters or words added at the beginning of the line: fols. 66va, 95va, 122va. - Omitted letters or words added at the end of the line: fols. 9rc, 16rc, 49vb, 67va, 77ra. - Corrections written over erasures: fols. 3va, 6ra, 8ra, 9rb, 11va, 12va, 14ra, 14vc etc. - Erasures marked with thin black lines: e.g., fols. 3ra, 6rb, 55vc, 65vb, 73ra. - Erasure marked with a crude black line: fol. 16vc. - Immediate corrections indicated by thin frames in black ink around the word or the sentence: fols. 37vc, 44rb, 55vc, 60rb, 62rb, 62vc. - Pen trial: fols. 1r, 1v. - Illegible note in pencil on fol. 138vc.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and to the tail of the codex.

Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover and on the turn-ins (at least 8 tools are used: cross hatching, double circle with dot, single line fillet, double sine wave with dots, double crescent with eye, criss-cross, corni-form, small x).

origin.origDate: According to the colophon the book was written in in the 2nd year of reign of King Täklä Giyorgis (= 1780 A.D.).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: According to the colophon, wäyzäro Wälättä Mikaʾel, wife of ras Mikaʾel “Sǝḥul” (ca. 1691-1777), commissioned and donated the Ms. to Däbrä Dammo. Wälättä Mikaʾel is also mentioned in the supplication formulas on fols. 3ra and 133vc.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
